summary: Medicare is required to monitor hospices through surveys every 3 years. Surveys can find serious quality issues, raising concerns about the adequacy of care and triggering additional monitoring. About 15% of hospices were cited with serious quality issues from 2020 through 2022. Medicare is working on, but hasn't fully implemented, enforcement tools—such as fines—to help bring hospices like these into compliance. In addition, as of...
title: Medicare Hospice: CMS Needs to Fully Implement Statutory Provisions and Prioritize Certain Overdue Surveys
